channel.title: CPU Throttling Because of PSU Temperature
channel.description: My CPU voltage is dropping from ~1.2V to 0.8V because the auxiliary temperature (AUXTIN in HWMonitor) skyrockets to 90 C and back down to 30-40 C randomly. It's a false reading and the voltage returns to normal after a couple seconds, but it's causing my CPU to be throttled and it's annoying. I know I can turn the throttling off, but I don't want to because I don't want to risk overheating my CPU if a real temperature reading is > 60C. Any advice?

item.title: CPU Throttling Because of PSU Temperature
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.source: CPU Throttling Because of PSU Temperature

item.title: CPU Throttling Because of PSU Temperature
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

[quote=“Pure_, post:2, topic:552141”]just turn it off[/quote]Starting to think that’s the only option

[quote=“my-swagger, post:3, topic:552141”]Have you checked the connection? It could just be a loose pin?[/quote]I haven’t, no, but I don’t think it’s a loose pin. Maybe something got damaged because it seems to only skyrocket under load and immediately go back down. Or maybe I shouldn’t have bought a $40 motherboard

Read full topic
